title: Embed blended analytics-style stats mockup above ASCII KARM section

requirements.text: Add a new landing-page UI block placed immediately above the existing ASCII 'KARM' text section that visually matches/blends with the current website style (black background + monochrome glass). The block must resemble the provided React Native `AnalyticsScreen` layout (header + central deck/cards feel), but implemented in the existing React + Tailwind codebase.

quotes: just above the ascii text can you put this screen and blend it with the website

acceptanceCriteria: On the landing page, a new stats/mock analytics block appears directly before the ASCII KARM renderer (i.e., above it in the scroll order).
The new block uses the siteâ€™s existing monochrome/glass styling (e.g., `.glass-panel` / `.glass-panel-strong`) and does not look like an unstyled embed.
No React Native / Expo-specific imports exist in the web code; the UI is recreated using React + Tailwind components.
The ASCII KARM renderer still renders and behaves as before.

requirements.text: Display fake (hard-coded) stats in the new analytics block: Level = 23, Karm = (23*3600), Habits = 4, Challenges = 24. Use these exact values and show Karm as a computed number (not the expression string).

quotes: also put fake stats like level 23, karm: (23*3600), 4 habits, and 24 challenges

acceptanceCriteria: The analytics block shows Karm equal to 82800 (computed from 23*3600).
All labels and visible text are in English.

requirements.text: Implement the blended background/atmosphere for the new analytics block using existing site patterns (e.g., optional subtle snow dots) and ensure it respects reduced-motion preferences similarly to the existing `SnowDotsBackground` effect.
acceptanceCriteria: If an animated background effect is used in the analytics block, it disables or becomes static when the user prefers reduced motion.
The analytics block content remains readable with sufficient contrast against the background.

requirements.text: Wire the new analytics block into the existing landing page composition by updating the relevant section/component(s) so the placement is 'just above the ASCII text' without altering unrelated sections.
acceptanceCriteria: LandingPage order results in the analytics block appearing immediately before the ASCII KARM section.
No other landing sections are removed or reordered besides inserting this new block in the correct position.

constraints: Do not edit files in frontend immutablePaths (e.g., `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x)`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, `frontend/src/components/ui`).
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor; no backend changes are required for fake stats.
Do not add React Native / Expo dependencies; recreate the UI using React + Tailwind in the existing frontend.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Implementing real analytics data fetching, persistence, or user accounts for these stats.
Porting the full React Native animation system 1:1 (Animated, BlurView, LinearGradient) into the web; only the visual feel needs to be recreated.
Changing the ASCII renderer implementation or its Three.js shaders.
